content.prompt:
The x axis ranges from negative 20 to 2 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 10 to 10 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate.

  • The parabola opens left and is symmetric about the x axis.
  • The curve enters the window at (negative 20.5 comma 9.1).
  • The curve decreases from left to right, passing through (negative 16 comma 8), (negative 9 comma 6), (negative 4 comma 4), (negative 1 comma 2), and (0 comma 0).
  • The curve changes directions at (0 comma 0), moving back to the left, decreasing from right to left.
  • The curve passes through (negative 1 comma negative 2), (negative 4 comma negative 4), (negative 9 comma negative 6), and (negative 16 comma negative 8).
  • The curve exits the window at (negative 20.5 comma negative 9.1).

The graph of a parabola is shown in the xy-plane. Which of the following is an analytical representation for the parabola?

choices.label: y2=-4x
y2=4x
x2=-4y
x2=4y

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
